description.raw:
The current actor implementation is broken (see issue [#1785](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1785/actor-does-not-render-properly)). This pull request aims to fix it and also merge the `rocon_actor` branch with `default`.

The fix can be found in `gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc`. The problem was that when the geometry of a visual was updated, its skeleton instance was not.

To manipulate an actor with a plugin, the `rocon_actor` branch introduced two new member functions `Actor::SetScriptTime()` and `Actor::ScriptTime()`. This pull request also suggests adding `Actor::SkeletonAnimations()` to get the list of all available animations for an actor, `Actor::SetCustomTrajectory()` to set its trajectory (using one of the animations), and `Actor::ResetCustomTrajectory()` to revert it back to its original state. When a custom trajectory is defined, the script time must be set by a plugin in order to play the animation.

Finally, this pull request reimplements the GUI action to show/hide the skeleton of a model or all skeletons at once.

The fix can be found in gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc. The problem was that when the geometry of a visual was updated, its skeleton instance was not.

To manipulate an actor with a plugin, the rocon_actor branch introduced two new member functions Actor::SetScriptTime() and Actor::ScriptTime(). This pull request also suggests adding Actor::SkeletonAnimations() to get the list of all available animations for an actor, Actor::SetCustomTrajectory() to set its trajectory (using one of the animations), and Actor::ResetCustomTrajectory() to revert it back to its original state. When a custom trajectory is defined, the script time must be set by a plugin in order to play the animation.
